critique: This executive order promotes waste prevention, recycling, and the use of environmentally preferable products and services within the Federal Government. It establishes a framework for agencies to incorporate these practices into their daily operations and procurement processes. There is no direct indication of ideological tilt. It does not address immigration. It does not expand executive power in any significant way. It does not directly address federalism. It does not directly address national security or civil liberties. It promotes government intervention in economic matters by mandating the use of recycled and environmentally preferable products. It does not directly address social inclusion.
